column2: Apap1313, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Horrible! Didn't even make me tired, and I was tired before I took it! Took one around midnight, still awake at 1am (and I was just lying in bed, eyes closed, dark room, trying my hardest to sleep and was still wide awake) .... Took another at 1:15am, another hour and a half goes by and still NOTHING! At this point I'm extremely frustrated considering I had to get up for work very early. I know I shouldn't have taken another but I was desperate and took a third at 3:30am, don't know exactly what time I actually fell asleep because I refused to look at the clock again, but I think I finally got worn out from crying, not from the pills. The next day at work I was miserable, couldn't pay attention to anything and had swollen puffy tired eyes. So embarrassing and miserable. Doesn't work.

column2: SVMainUS, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Even after trying 3 at onr time, I am wide awake all night. Doesn't do a thing for me.

column2: Robert, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I normally wake up several times a night and once in a while can't get back to sleep for a hour or two. With Unisom I fall asleep quickly and don't wake up but a time or two.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking a store brand version of Unisom that is available in an extra strength sleep gel (same ingredients at about 1/2 the price) and have been have been reasonable satisfied with the results. I still can't seem to stay asleep more than 4 hours at a time.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Kmain, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had what appears to be a rare and severe series of side effects to this drug, one pill. I had to be hospitalized... Symptoms with 1 gel cap + water; Greatly elevated heart rate, dry mouth, nervousness, muscle spasms, anemia... I will never take this pill again or anything with the active ingredients in it. Beware this is dangerous stuff!

column2: June, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After back surgery a year ago and taking pain meds I have been unable to sleep.  I have tried various prescription meds and had side affects.  Also my MD had me coming back monthly to renew the prescription.  I tried Unisom and have been able to fall asleep.  I am a little groggy in the morning but not too much.

column2: bikerchickYZFR1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: worked GREAT at first... then after 3 weeks of taking it I'm finding that I'm groggy all the time & sleeping through the day.  I have always had intense dreams where I struggle or fight-- but after 2 weeks of unisom I started actually swinging my fists or legs in my sleep (which I a=have never done in my 25 years of life) resulting in punching my husband square in the face & kicking the dresser next to the bed so hard that I almost broke toes.  After the dresser incident I am calling it quits with unisom!  Maybe I will only use it once in a while if I can't sleep but long term use is no good!!!

column2: Sleeping Again, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Cannot turn my mind off at night.  I take one half of an otc to settle me down.  It works.

column2: jen107709, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: used to take ambien for insomnia, this is just a trial thing until i get insurance again. It works ok but sometimes I have to take 2 or 3 pills to even get tired and then it will still take several hours to fall asleep. The only good thing is once I am asleep, I remain asleep and when I do wake up to turn over I dont toss and turn for hours trying to fall back to sleep. I guess it works ok but for my severe case of insomnia I would prefer something a little stronger. Also it has started to give me headaches, worse than ever and I believe that it has started to trigger migraines for me. Something I will be talking to the doctor about soon to find out if the medicince has something to do with it.

column2: Katiedid2010, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use generic Unisom and it is cheap and effectice. It helps me go to sleep and sleep all night. I wake up refreshed and ready for the day. I would say one thing, take it earlier than later. It takes effect within 10-15 minutes after ingestion. I LOVE IT!

column2: destynul, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have trouble sleeping and staying asleep.  I had recently switch from one over the coutner sleep aide to Unisom. As far as me falling asleep and staying asleep, it works well.  However,in the morning I feel extremely tired and spaced out. I am not able to focus and am not "myself" until later on in the day. I have noticed when I first put the pill o my tongue it has a strange "tingle". Im not sure if its worth worrying about though.

column2: Elvira, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Chronic insomnia, have taken Ambien in the past. 1/2 tab (12.5 mg) Unisom helped me fall asleep after 1 hr., and I slept well, but awakened 8 hrs. later feeling spacey, dizzy, had difficulty focusing vision, no ambition for the day, difficulty with memory and speech. Ambien caused no side effects such as this. Will never take this med again. Benadryl causes similiar side effects. I may just be overly sensitive to antihistamines.

column2: Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: using unisom sleep because I do not sleep well the drug has been a great help

column2: Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Side effects included feeling slightly spacey in the following mornigng. Balance and fine motor skills felt as if they were comprimised but weren't. Feelings did not wear off until noontime. I will use only when really sleep deprived in the future.

column2: roxy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My daughter in-law was told to take this drug, to relieve her nausa during her 1st trimester  during her pregnancy... could this cause problems with the babies development?

column2: karen uses too, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a problem falling and staying asleep. It works as good if not better than ambian I'm pretty happy with it just wish it would last longer. still only getting about 4-5 hours per night. I need to take it atleast 1 hour before bedtime or It takes even longer to relax and actually fall asleep. I had horrible results with ambian wich is rx only..I don't get vivid dreams or sleepwalk with this. Another good effect with taking this is, I don't need to take my allergy medicine. I'm saving money! I would recommend this medicine!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: If I'm stressed, I can't sleep, or I wake up at 2AM and can't fall back to sleep. I take just 1/4 of a pill and I sleep all night. If I drink lots of water when I wake up, I don't get the headache. Love it.

column2: tammy_mcgwn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: does not really help drowiness.

column2: jswenden, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used this product on nights where i felt like I couldn't fall asleep at a decent hour and i have something important to do in the morning. I woke up refreshed! It's great!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Unisom Sleeptabs help me to sleep through the night, however, in the morning I wake up with a severe headache thats last most of the day. Otherwise it does what it says it does.

column2: bogie, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took one pill at ten oclock and woke up before 12 with pain and restlessness. I could not lay still. I had to get up because of the severe need to move and jerking of my entire body

column2: JANFROST@AOL.COM, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: IT IS WONDERFUL!

column2: unisomn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have no trouble , using this, but want to know if ingredeients in this medication, have side effects; and if so what are they

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Amazing!  One of these little pills is equal to 4 tablespoons of Nyquil.  One pill!  I sleep so sound and feel so well rested!

column2: gman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have apnea and I have to have something to help me with the mask otherwise I would never be able to fall asleep.Acually would like something stronger.I have to take 3 gel caps before I can get some sleep.One night I had to take 5.

column2: taybey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this last night and slept through the night except for using the bathroom.  I will continue to take this for a good nights sleep, I highly recommend it if you have trouble sleeping.

My ob/gyn recommended this to me to treat my nausea. It is the ONLY thing that has given me relief. I take it at night and feel like myself again throughout the next day, plus I get a good nights sleep in the process!

column2: Gromme 5,  Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Overall use has been good.  Can you tell me if this falls under the benzo family? I am in recovery and do not want to mess with anything that may create problems in my recovery.  Thanks.

column2: MagyMay, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had trouble sleeping most of my life it was after a near miss while driving my car that I realized I needed a good night sleep no matter what, I didnt want to use ambien or anything that strong I started to take unisom gel (1 little pil) Last summer 2 hours before bedtime, I sleep all night and wake up like a brand new person every day, I wouldnt trade a good night sleep for anything!! I never realized how important it was until now. I buy the target brand sometimes and the benfits out weigh the negatives.

column2: counselor, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I sleep wonderfully with this drug.  No hangover and I awake feeling rested.

column2: pregnantRN, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took unisome after I had tried everthing else to treat morning sickness. It was the only thing that worked. I took it at night and slept well and had little nausea the next day. I took it with my last two pregancys and both my children are healthy.
It really helps Insomnia but must take 2 hours before bedtime
